data.text: STARTING NOW: Hear from IMF's FDMD Gita Gopinath, Reserve Bank of India Deputy Gov T. Rabi Sankar, Monetary Authority of Singapore Chief Fintech Officer Sopnendu Mohanty and othersernor on the future of digital payments in India and beyond: https://t.co/ZSj7i15fBG https://t.co/iDBCGPdFKM

The pandemic underscored 🇯🇵Japan’s uneven embrace of technology, but digitalization could help provide additional momentum for an economy facing longer-term headwinds from an aging population to stagnant productivity growth. https://t.co/xmQYUEE4bw https://t.co/R6tKqWoN7S

🇯🇵Japan’s economy is recovering from the pandemic as consumption gradually rebounds, and the pace of expansion could accelerate to 2.4% this year, the most in 12 years. See IMF Country Focus for more on how the country can boost growth. https://t.co/xmQYUEE4bw https://t.co/0DjnKYwvu0

Keep an eye out for our newest edition of F&D, launching June 2. We examine the economic dimensions of the current geopolitical situation, including the war in Ukraine, refugees, and food prices. https://t.co/CT2rbCnXXY https://t.co/lURoDOoVaF

At the IMF, we have prioritized gaining a more holistic understanding of the implications of climate change for the global financial system and financial stability. 

Read Tobias Adrian's opening remarks from today's policy dialogue on the Asia-Pacific: https://t.co/FMor0lPovq https://t.co/Zi2ppYpHyw

The US dollar has long played an outsized role in global markets. It continues to do so even as the American economy has been producing a shrinking share of global output over the last two decades. https://t.co/G7Ad1kofBA https://t.co/UxVPN6Gfq0

The spike in global energy prices since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine provides a compelling reason to accelerate the green transition to low-carbon energy, according to our latest #IMFBlog. https://t.co/HCm4ICLSqr https://t.co/SPEIXFNeKj

The currencies of economies such as 🇦🇺Australia, 🇨🇦Canada, 🇰🇷Korea, and 🇸🇪Sweden now account for three-quarters of the latest shift from dollars in the composition of global foreign-exchange reserves. Check out our Chart of the Week. https://t.co/UCcv8qdJQK https://t.co/irKoPKHLVW

Did you miss today’s policy dialogue on climate-related financial risks and green finance in the Asia-Pacific region? 

Learn more about the event here: https://t.co/0aYTmwBcEp and watch the discussion: https://t.co/9N2TnhkfI1 https://t.co/b3cCZJewNg

“We must find urgent ways to attract more climate funding, especially for emerging and developing economies,” said @KGeorgieva today at an IMF policy dialogue on green finance in the Asia-Pacific region.

Learn more here: https://t.co/0aYTmwBcEp https://t.co/kvpryDm2BY
Our new Charts in Motion shows the IMF’s latest inflation projections. Read more about the factors shaping the outlook here. https://t.co/q8hIplWw9g https://t.co/IgA8j03E7x

How much of your salary is fair to pay as tax? @PaoloMauroEcon writes in F&D that public finance could gain broader support by considering moral perspectives. https://t.co/WbGLbTc4lc https://t.co/8hAV62fW7L

June 2 at 7:00am ET // At the Frontier: India's Digital Payment System and Beyond will explore the latest developments in digital payments with a focus on lessons from India as well as future with a significant role for Central Bank Digital Currencies. https://t.co/ZSj7i15fBG https://t.co/X6cVyHewEs

Official GDP data take weeks or months to become available, but IMF researchers have developed a "nowcasting" tool enabled by machine learning to track economies in real-time. See #IMFBlog for more. https://t.co/QI4KJafclN https://t.co/etdASpGoX3
There is a great deal of talk about stagflation today. But what is it exactly? We break it down in our new series: Jargone. https://t.co/4jStBM4H7U https://t.co/v4DFZOBea0

Spikes in commodity prices, imbalances in supply and demand, and a shortage of workers are among the main factors shaping the outlook for inflation. Swipe/click to read more about each. https://t.co/z040pKrmZu

Popular discontent over fast-rising food and fuel prices, among other factors, could spur social unrest and slow economic growth, according to our latest blog. https://t.co/KIlREl6mGc https://t.co/GM5yrvzC3M

To boost growth amid the pandemic and the war, we must strengthen trade, step up efforts to deal with debt, modernize cross-border payments, and confront climate change. https://t.co/LM2q31jnrR https://t.co/V5dV00rOvN
How do we improve financial cooperation, build resilience and reimagine globalization to benefit all? Check out F&D for the latest Editor's Pick. https://t.co/z8CRWeDVEL https://t.co/Q74JUKluje

Join us for a policy dialogue with Asia-Pacific policymakers to explore the implications of climate change for financial stability, central bank and regulatory policies, and the greening of financial markets.

📅 June 1
⏱️ 7:30 AM ET (11:30 AM GMT)
💻 https://t.co/FCnwbtPLf6 https://t.co/joZXn3Ow8g

Test your understanding of macroeconomic analysis—compete in the 4th annual #IMFchallenge. Eligible undergraduates from universities in Africa, Asia, Middle East, Central Asia, the Caucasus, and Pacific Islands can register by June 1. https://t.co/yOIvQ5fzKZ https://t.co/0nlx3JXk3v
Check out our latest series ➡️ Jargone. Get quick, simple definitions of key economics concepts. Want to learn more? Watch our Back to Basics series: https://t.co/4jStBM4H7U https://t.co/3HqdWYdDru

Watch our latest Charts in Motion to find out why inflation will remain elevated for longer than previously forecast. Read more about the main factors shaping the outlook here. https://t.co/q8hIplWw9g https://t.co/FI9b09TDwa

IMF's Karla Vasquez and Kika Alex-Okoh analyzed various legal frameworks on debt transparency in 65 countries across 5 continents. This is what they found: https://t.co/DK62ETFv9s https://t.co/JKYxv793MG

Wheat prices rose to a record with the war in Ukraine—the countries make up almost a third of world exports. With high food costs poised to keep rising, inflation may accelerate. https://t.co/UqhHKzZXUn https://t.co/3HKjJLMj4y

Sub-Saharan Africa is experiencing yet another shock, which will slow growth to 3.8% in 2022. IMF's @aselassie presents our analysis in the latest Regional Economic Outlook. https://t.co/JStBGpZFNu #IMFAfrica https://t.co/L3lLoV8ZCj

There’s an African proverb: “We desire to bequeath two things to our children; the first one is roots, the other is wings.” Watch this short video of the IMF's Rasmane Ouedraogo discussing new research on social mobility in Africa: https://t.co/SAm9IZp0h7 https://t.co/MW8aGnOuty

The world economy faces perhaps its biggest test in decades as war in Ukraine sharply increases the risk of geoeconomic fragmentation. See our blog for four priorities to help restore trust in the global system. https://t.co/LM2q31jnrR https://t.co/RqZjD6OKpX

Policy choices for oil-importing countries in the Middle East and North Africa are becoming increasingly complex as inflation accelerates despite fragile economic recoveries. More on our blog. https://t.co/RlUQlpxAXP https://t.co/skT2QpJo3s

The war in Ukraine is pushing prices up even further. For Latin America, we estimate that a combined 10 percentage points increase in both oil and food prices would raise inflation by 1.1 percentage points. https://t.co/eGmBZz68ye https://t.co/jvE1tFaCmQ
Sub-Saharan Africa imports around 85% of its wheat supply. Read our blog for more on the impact of the war in Ukraine on food security in the region. https://t.co/CWu4VbrHZz https://t.co/XQn2dA84vV
What is stagflation? Our latest video explains in 15 seconds. Learn more about key economics concepts in our Back to Basics series. https://t.co/4jStBM4H7U https://t.co/FGaPx1CpXf

How does war affect global finance? We explain in this video. https://t.co/yaiJHqv3Gq https://t.co/PeFPffaaGh

We can think about digital money as a global public good. In that context, we are calling for a public platform to connect different central bank digital currencies with interoperability the same way you would transfer money from one country to another - @KGeorgieva at #WEF22 https://t.co/4gUWp6jgrU

Tune in with the IMF's Jihad Azour at the @CH_MENAP with Creon Butler of @CH_EconFin for a conversation on the economic issues facing the MENA region in 2022. 
Register here 👉https://t.co/gJCJcnSOnS https://t.co/JZgywSFFjz

We all need to be increasingly concerned about the growing economic divergence between different economies @KGeorgieva told a @wef panel.  

Rather than catching up with the better off,  poor countries are falling further behind. #WEF22 https://t.co/so278bqyvS

It is going to be a tough year ahead @KGeorgieva told the participants @wef.  The IMF has downgraded its growth projections for 143 countries or 86% of global GDP.  There are a number of reasons for this bleaker outlook. #WEF22 https://t.co/hNCETtfSWo

Food prices accounted for 60% of last year’s increase in headline inflation in the Middle East and North Africa, excluding the Gulf, and we expect inflation of 13.9% this year. Read our latest #IMFblog. https://t.co/RlUQlpxAXP https://t.co/79rvpfs7WX

For oil-importing countries in the Middle East and North Africa, costlier commodities are adding to challenges of inflation, debt, and rising global interest rates, according to our latest #IMFblog.
https://t.co/RlUQlpxAXP https://t.co/cYKH4jjLzo

How much have global food prices increased? Watch our video and read our blog to find out. https://t.co/UqhHKzIn2P https://t.co/ESamYte9JU

Beyond the humanitarian crisis of the war in Ukraine, all the world’s regions will experience slower growth and faster inflation. 

Higher food and energy costs will be one of the main channels of the global impact, which we lay out in our blog. https://t.co/LY1urh4vrj https://t.co/EOicBrJBJh

Chile’s new IMF Short-term Liquidity Line is a signal of confidence in the country’s very strong economic fundamentals. This new arrangement, predictable and revolving, complements 🇨🇱Chile’s ample reserves. 

Read the interview. https://t.co/hkTqCOQ0Ny https://t.co/hhZSRYRGvF

The Climate Innovation Challenge is one way the IMF and its partners are tackling the global issue of climate change.  Join us and our partners @SECO_CH & @WorldResources on May 26 as we select the winners! #imfinnovation 

Learn more: https://t.co/Vv8Yd76Y5t https://t.co/dDSNQx7GKb

Higher prices for commodities like food and energy will be one of the main channels for how the war in Ukraine will further affect the global economy. Our blog details how every region will feel the effects. https://t.co/LY1urh4vrj https://t.co/l0SptxnBtL

Korea's economy remains resilient, but Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and related sanctions have exacerbated concerns about the risks of stagflation. Our new Country Focus blog has more. https://t.co/hGqxkU6EYZ https://t.co/HCEMvZPWgd

Check it out here: https://t.co/pa1mTfIEkH https://t.co/Mmagcaltis
Social unrest can mean lost output in manufacturing and services, as consumers become spooked by uncertainty, as our latest blog explains. https://t.co/KIlREkOLhC https://t.co/RV0ZV8XfQb

Chile’s new IMF Short-term Liquidity Line is a signal of confidence in the country’s very strong economic fundamentals. This new arrangement, predictable and revolving, complements Chile’s ample reserves. Read the interview. https://t.co/hkTqCOQ0Ny https://t.co/r1VaaGXVEA

Inflation is showing up in different ways and in various parts of the world. This Chart of the Week shows how food prices are driving inflation in sub-Saharan Africa. https://t.co/qYWgCogibd https://t.co/0QtiG0cGwl

Registration for the 2022 #IMFchallenge, designed to test your economic savvy, is now open to eligible undergraduates in Africa, Asia, Middle East, Central Asia, the Caucasus, and Pacific Islands. See details and register by June 1, 2022. https://t.co/eUlYUFRUwU https://t.co/39PGjAbmXL

Chile was among the first to recover from the COVID crisis thanks to the right policies to help people & the economy. An IMF Short-term Liquidity Line will help support the recovery.

Read our interview w/@bcentralchile @rosanna_costac & IMF Mission Chief. https://t.co/hkTqCOQ0Ny https://t.co/PA7bY5AIMY

This arrangement is the first Short-term Liquidity Line ever approved by the IMF. 

The Short-term Liquidity Line will support 🇨🇱 Chile’s economic resilience by providing a backstop for potential, moderate, short-term liquidity needs. [2/3]

🇨🇱 Chile accepted the IMF’s offer of a one-year Short-term Liquidity Line arrangement, amounting to about US$3.5 billion. The authorities notified the IMF of their decision to exit the Flexible Credit Line (FCL). [1/3] https://t.co/CYQbVaIXWm

Deputy Managing Director Kenji Okamura spoke at an event hosted by @IMF_Tokyo today on the Asia-Pacific regional economic outlook. Read our latest research on the region here: https://t.co/9X30FgWZDp https://t.co/m5nWGsHy6n

This year, large and long-running anti-government demonstrations have occurred in advanced economies where unrest is relatively rare, such as Canada and New Zealand. Read more in our blog. https://t.co/NqxBCWoGl9 https://t.co/MRXI7ixuoQ
Prices of oil and gas have soared since the war in Ukraine. Watch our video to learn about the impact of rising prices and how countries can respond. https://t.co/yaiJHqdsOS https://t.co/FTH8YGll0x

After a pause in protests during the first year of the pandemic, people are returning to the streets. A rise in social unrest could pose risks to the global economic recovery. Read our blog. https://t.co/UCcv8qdJQK https://t.co/v4UU98lsuA

Wheat prices rose to a record with the war in Ukraine—the countries make up almost a third of world exports. With high food costs poised to keep rising, inflation may accelerate. https://t.co/UqhHKzIn2P #IMFBlog https://t.co/3ktLJItCtn

Join us on May 26 at 3PM ET ➡️ The IMF’s Climate Innovation Challenge. Watch 8 teams pitch their ideas LIVE on how to integrate climate change into economic analysis and help us and our partners @SECO_CH & @WorldResources select the winners!

Learn more: https://t.co/Vv8Yd76Y5t https://t.co/7dmGJlm4sl

The spike in global energy prices since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine provides a compelling reason to accelerate the green transition to low-carbon energy, according to our latest #IMFBlog. https://t.co/HCm4ICuh1R https://t.co/u7sol7cE3s

An international floor price for carbon could speed the world’s transition to green energy without compromising countries’ competitiveness. Read more in our latest #IMFBlog. https://t.co/HCm4ICuh1R https://t.co/2qH2Ghlb2S

Countries with arrears of government debt that need IMF financing will benefit from the Fund’s new policies on this issue. 

Read the Q&A for all the updates. https://t.co/cOrqTomYdo https://t.co/khomXBJgAV

Jordanian Finance Minister Mohamad Al-Ississ talks to IMF’s Jihad Azour @AkhbarAsunduk on the importance of economic and financial resilience to navigate uncertainty & collaborating with the international community to foster long-term growth in #GovTalks. https://t.co/WoP5iAaQNE https://t.co/oUZuT3gmL2

Finland was the first country to introduce a carbon tax. It’s now finding new, sustainable ways to use wood and bio-based materials instead of plastics, concrete, and steel. F&D looks at this innovation. https://t.co/EZpEDt3aSG https://t.co/JHfG3UjQNK

Informal employment has rebounded much more than formal work in G20 emerging economies including Brazil, Indonesia, Mexico, and South Africa since the depths of the pandemic. See #IMFBlog for more on how labor markets are changing. https://t.co/CQIScAh46Y https://t.co/UupWdiPmqq

The IMF Executive Board concluded the regular quinquennial review of the method of valuation of the basket of currencies that make up Special Drawing Rights. The IMF will conclude the next review before end-July 2027.

Read all the details: https://t.co/pRVOaUk5UI https://t.co/harCHC9OT3

The IMF Executive Board’s regular quinquennial review of the method of valuation of the basket of currencies that make up the Special Drawing Rights suggests there have been no major changes in the roles of currencies in the world economy. Read more:
https://t.co/7KZBeFbLOq https://t.co/iXSwUYG5xl

G20 economies continue to recover from the pandemic, but the shock could still leave long-lasting scars that reduce economic prospects compared with pre-crisis trends. See our latest IMF Blog for how policies can reduce scarring. https://t.co/CQIScAh46Y https://t.co/HZhGEIjbN4

Finland was the first country to introduce a carbon tax in 1990. Now the country aims to be the first advanced carbon-neutral country by 2035. Learn more in F&D: https://t.co/EZpEDt3aSG https://t.co/HEL1AULE4Q

Economist Dr. Lisa D. Cook’s research is a clarion call to integrate not only diversity of thought but also diversity of lived experience into economics and the world beyond. Check out the profile of the new Federal Reserve Board governor on F&D. https://t.co/iN8Tvlm9tj https://t.co/Z6C602zuHL
Inflation: what does the future hold? Read our F&D analytical series by Ruchir Agarwal and Miles Kimball, here: https://t.co/sQD8khMP0D https://t.co/QCgWlL6aiH
